etymologies: late Middle English: via Old French from late Latin melo, melon-, contraction of Latin melopepo, from Greek mēlopepōn, from mēlon ‘apple’ + pepōn ‘gourd’

definitions: the large round fruit of a plant of the gourd family, with sweet pulpy flesh and many seeds

examples.text: a ripe melon will smell sweet

definitions: the Old World plant which yields the melon.

notes.text: Cucumis melo subsp. melo, family Cucurbitaceae: many varieties

definitions: a mass of waxy material in the head of dolphins and other toothed whales, thought to focus acoustic signals.
a large profit, especially a stock dividend, to be divided among a number of people

examples.text: you can just see them sitting around the room cutting up the melon in advance

shortDefinitions: large profit to be divided among several people
